reviews.review_msg: Took her class in Fall 2024. I couldn't handle the 3 hour lectures. The midterm and final were a bit difficult. Whoever is reading this, just like what other ppl before me wrote, FOCUS ON HER POWERPOINT SLIDES for the midterm/final. Remember the studies/experiments mentioned in class/on the slides & understand what happened in those experiments !!!

Expect mandatory groupwrk at the end of every lecture & bring earplugs to exams in case she still lets TAs chat loudly w/ eachother throughout. "Two-stage" structure might've helped some students, but 2nd stage HAD to be written in self-organized grps, so only sociable folks were able to benefit. Quiet/neurodivergent individuals seemed to be SOL.

Provides engaging lectures, and breaks info down to where it feels easy. There were two papers that seemed straightforward but were actually graded pretty harsh. The midterm and final were both two-stage exams which were helpful for a little boost!

Lectures are interesting & engaging. There are very few assignments with only two papers and an online mastery quiz. The quiz is super easy & the papers seem easy at first but are graded very harshly. The midterm and final were reasonable but difficult. However, I would definitely recommend taking this course as Dr. Aknin is an amazing lecturer.

Lara was an amazing prof. I loved her lectures, they were super engaging and she gave great examples of social psychology phenomena in action. Her review sessions before exams were extremely helpful. If you have listened to her lectures and follow her review guide you will be prepared for the exam. Loved her energy as well.
Aknin gave engaging lectures. Clearly passionate and knowledgeable about materials. Went out of her way to give accommodations. Lectures are a little long but in general a good experience.

Dr. Aknin is an amazing professor who is clearly passionate abt the course. The 3hr lec was rough, but tried her best to make them engaging. The TAs graded harshly, especially for an intro course. Didn't like the peer pod concept, members rarely showed up (fair enough) left all the work on you, and received a mark only if you stayed till the end.

Amazing prof, take her class!!! 3 hour lectures suck but she made it so fun and easily absorbable. TA's were fair and her exams dont try to trick you like lots of psyc exams do, if you study youll do really well. she uses sooo many real life examples and gives constant lecture outlines and updates to make 3 hour lectures feel super manageable.

Lara is such an engaging professor. She makes lectures fun and interesting. The three hours is horrid tho. I will say that the TA's wrecked this class for me. Lara was so accommodating and seemed like she was clear with what she wanted. The TA's were unfair and graded HARD. I studied too, this isn't a "you didn't try, so your grade reflects that".

Lara is an amazing prof! she is super passionate about what she teaches and has a very in depth lecture. However, most of the stuff that is on exams are based off the lectures, not too much textbook although it is still good to read. She takes feedback very well and does her best to incorporate it to make things easier for us

Lara gives entertaining, straightforward lectures and also lays out what kinds of questions will be on the exams so there should be no surprise. Her midterm/final guides are extremely helpful, she is caring and makes it easy for you to do well in the course. Lectures are audio recorded as well.

Dr. Aknin is a good professor and does her job well. The content of PSYC 260 is easy, therefore it is easy to do well, but the marking of exams and assignments made it difficult to really control your grade I found. Was not a fan of her TAs and their marking/feedback at all, which really impacted how I view her, and the course itself.
Lara's lectures are awesome, she is probably the best prof I ever had. Super caring and accommodating, and explains concepts really well with real life examples.

Lara is arguably one of the best profs at SFU. She genuinely cares about students, responds promptly to emails, and takes feedback into consideration. She made her exam criteria very clear and hosted final review sessions that clearly described what she was looking for. She was very fair and made it easy to learn. STAN LARA

Dr. Lara Aknin is one of the nicest professors I have ever had. The lectures are really engaging and most of them are posted so it is easy to catch up if you miss a class. I didn't totally understand what was asked of me for the MeSearch assignment, but the class was generally fair and actually quite fun.

Dr Aknin gives very engaging lectures and properly communicates clearly about any updates or rescheduling to do with assignments. Her enthusiasm for social psychology is contagious! Highly recommend this prof!
Lovely, caring professor with engaging lectures, fair marking (as long as you do the readings and work!) and super accessible outside class hours! Highly recommend.

Lara is a very passionate professor who cares about the success of her students. A very detailed syllabus with clear guidelines so students know what to expect from the class and lectures are designed to be engaging. Textbook reading is definitely necessary to do well on exams, but the information is interesting so it's easy to retain.

Great prof, you can tell she is very passionate about the subject. Will happily answer any question you ask her in class, cares a lot about her students. Textbook is provided and you should read it. Make sure to pay attention to the studies and theories that she talks about in lecture, as her short answer questions will ask about them.

Lara is passionate in what she teaches, which makes the lectures very entertaining. Although the exams and assignments were fair, the grading criteria was a little vague. However, Lara is an amazing prof as she genuinely wants everyone to do well in her class. The readings are manageable and the course itself is super interesting.

Class content is very interesting and highly applicable to daily life, but there are so MANY things to remember which makes the exams a bit hard. Prof is very caring and enthusiastic; she always try to make class interesting. She seems to genuinely want to know students outside of classroom and really open to conversation.

Her teaching style is really engaging and makes everything very clear. You can tell she really likes the topic and wants you to learn and apply it to yourself. The weekly readings are not much and the topics are more discussed in the lectures. If you go to the lectures and read the chapter for the week, you're good for exams.

She loves the material and it shows, she loves teaching and it shows, really concerned about getting feedback and she implements it the next week. She is also well-known in her field of research. Overall, she is legit. Take this class with her, it's super interesting.

Aknin's midterm and final were both pretty easy--just focus on the core concepts, and don't bother memorizing names or dates. The criteria for projects was a little vague, but she asks for feedback at the end of every class and I think it really helps her improve. Beware that when she says 10 minute break, she'll usually restart class after 7 mins.
Lara is incredible. You're not graded on much, and the exams are fair and very straightforward if you study.

Best prof at sfu! Lectures are engaging, criteria is clearly articulated and concepts are well defined with lots of examples to facilitate knowledge. The class is test heavy but if you study the material and connect the research studies discussed in class with course concepts you will do really well. Highly recommend!

She is amazing! She responds to emails quickly, follows up with you and tries her best to accommodate as much as she can when it comes to scheduling office hours outside her regular times. Read the textbook, and highly recommend to make quizlets based on the lectures and readings, it'll help before the final and midterm! Also, know the examples!

This was my favourite class ever, Lara is an incredible prof. She is very receptive to feedback and structures her exams and assignments purposefully and clearly. I even had fun writing the midterm, I don't know how she does it. She is an engaging and thoughtful speaker, I loved attending lectures each week! If you can take Lara's classes, DO IT!!

You can tell she likes teaching! Pay attention to examples of studies and take notes she will test you on being able to give an example of a phenomenon. Read the text book. Assignments and tests are fair. Would definitely take another one of her classes!
Dr. Aknin was a wonderful professor. Not only were the lectures interesting and filled with lot's of cool elements, she was overall a kind and approachable person. Would take a course with her again.
She's really nice, one of the best professors Ive ever had.
Her exam questions were way too specific considering the simplified nature of her lecture material.

Awesome prof. So passionate about the course content which really helps you care too. Classes were prerecorded which allowed lots of flexibility. I dont know that youd get much extra out of having the class in person - the lectures were still very dynamic. You need to take her class. She preps you for the exams and is very easy to contact if you.
Great professor, great lecture. you can learn a lot from her lecture. but grading is difficult. be prepared for that.
Be prepared to have your papers marked like your in graduate school, either than that the lectures are engaging and Lara is very approachable as well as her TAs.

Dr. Aknin is very approachable and knowledgeable. I enjoy listening to her lectures as they were pretty engaging. What you learn is interesting, but grading is a little difficult. Overall, good class as I learned a lot, but it probably won't reflect on my grades. Recommended!

Lara is definitely one of the best profs I've had! She genuinely wants everyone to do well, and her lectures are extremely clear and helpful. Class exams/assignments are lecture based, but the textbook is useful in clarifying certain topics. Grading can be tricky, but the key is to not just be able to recite information, but apply it accordingly.

This class significantly lowered my gpa this semester. Although I studied hard and was very well prepared for exams, she purposefully formulates the questions to trip people up. Choose another class instead.

Dr. Aknin was an extremely difficult prof who gave very unfair exams not at all set up to show case that you actually learned something. All of her assignments were graded at a very high academic writing stand point considering this is a second year non writing course. Miss one experimental study she talks about, you won't pass

Dr. Aknin was an awesome prof! She's very approachable and cared a lot about her students success. She articulated concepts very clearly and had relatable examples. One of the best profs I have ever had at SFU. The only downside is the marking is kinda tough, but that could be because of the TA's I had. The course had 2 exams and a few assignments.

Really tough grader. Her exam material is not fair, even if you read the textbook and study intensively it is hard to get above a passing grade. Her exams ask you to draw from a very specific example she would talk about for a sec and never mentions it again. Lots of papers to write when this is NOT a W course and you are graded on grammar andstyle

I'm not sure why everyone is saying she is grading super tough and that the exam had unfair questions, if you studied, and literally just read the textbook/lectures, you should be fine. Her questions were fair and she made everything interesting with great examples and research. No need to lash out if you weren't prepared to study for a class.
reconsider taking this class. Questions on the exam consist of things she spoke about for maybe .5 seconds. very strange. inconsiderate given current circumstances
She makes a simple course 10X harder than it needs to be. Do not take 260 with her. Hard marker

Lara Aknin makes the content really easy to understand and remember through stories and examples. She stresses an understanding of concepts over remote memorization making it easier to study for exams. Her online class was super organized and straight forward. She is super kind and enthusiastic about her class. Would definitely recommend!

Lara is a good lecturer. She explains information well. The problem I had with the class is that the criteria in the guidelines is different from what you're marked on. Also, she wasn't open to hearing my concerns about the marking of my paper and was dismissive of my concerns. Also gave a a 20% exam during the last week of classes.
She was a really great prof. Just try not to have a family member die unexpectedly. She is unforgiving with due dates and being at a funeral is no excuse for a late paper.
Best professor I've had at SFU so far! Lara is so passionate, engaging and caring. Her lectures are interesting and relevant to real life. I would highly recommend taking a class with her.
Very good prof, interesting information that is applicable to real life. As long as you do your work you should succeed! She uses a lot of relatable examples and is very caring!

This class was great. Dr Aknin puts a lot of effort into the class to make it relevant, and it shows. Very fun and interesting class. It's not a free class though, you still need to invest some effort, though I didn't need to work that hard to do well.  There is a group project though

Lara made lectures fun and engaging, and to top it off, she is super passionate in her subject area, which is a definite plus. She incorporated a lot of real life examples and stories, which helped a lot. Tests were tricky and the TAs were strict in their marking, so study and do assignments ahead of time! I would definitely recommend this prof! Co

Lara Aknin is really nice and she seems very interested into the topics! However, the grading system is different from other courses and the TAs mark the assignments really hard, while 50% is a pass for other classes, 55% is a pass for this course. And 56%-64% is a D. Got 71% as a final grade, and only received a C.

Lara is the best prof I have ever had. She is so helpful and loves what she is teaching. Her lectures are long but they are entertaining and so informative. I didn't really even need my text book all semester. There are a number of assignments and they aren't that easy but they're worh it. If you can take a class with her, do it, so amazing.

Highly recommend this class to anyone interested in social psychology! Lara is awesome! Lectures are extremely well-organized, she is very methodical with how the class will go. She offers awesome examples of every concept and encourages questions. Very approachable. Assignments are easy-peasy and the exams are very do-able.

Lara has so much passion for the subject that every class was interesting despite it being 3 hours long. The midterm and final exams were fair and Lara goes out of her way to make study sessions where she tells you exactly what to study. Group assignments and individual papers are easy marks! would definitely recommend this class for sure!
Group project is helpful and everyone can share their notes. Examples provided in class are interesting and really applied in our lives.

Really enjoyed this class! All the lectures and lecture slides are posted online within 2 hours, although she does show some videos in class that will not show up on the slides. Put in the time and effort and an A is attainable!

Honestly she is hands down the absolute best prof i have ever had at SFU! She makes 3hour lectures really enjoyable by adding a lot of humour and she's very nice and approachable! her exams are very fair just know the lecture slides and your golden. i found that the TA marked the papers a little hard though

Lara is AWESOME! she's enthusiastic, funny and even though lecture was 5:30 to 8:30pm it was worth it every time. My only complaint about Lara is that the emphasizes too much on different research and not enough on the theories themselves. However, I would take another one of her classes in a heartbeat. Simply awesome
A really really really good professor!!! very organized, clear     65

She is the best professor ever. It's the end of the semester and I can't believe I've learned so many theories so well and clear. She teaches so well, lots of examples,interesting clips related to theory, activities, etc. she really wants students to learn. She made this course so easy and enjoyable. Just AWESOME :)
Very good professor! extremely organized in her lectures and always has good class examples and videos.

The best prof ever, she is such an interesting prof, she try her best to give the best to her student. I would love to take another course with her again. Never ever meet another prof as great as her so far.
An excellent professor I've ever had!!

Best professor I've ever had! She has both competence and attitudes as great prof.She is always well prepared and very organized, and communicates with students really well. She is the type of prof who makes her students fall in love with her course.I am very satisfied with her teaching, and I wish all profs at SFU were just like her.

SHE IS THE BEST PROF EVER. I didn't even get the grade I thought I would, but I am so happy i got to take her class. She really puts her students before herself. She replies to every email, and is very helpful with anything you need! Definitely wish I could be in her class again someday. GO LARA!!

The best Prof that I ever have at sfu,  she is the best beat Prof, her class is super interesting and she very helpful, and she try to do her best to teach the class, music before class every lecture, she make sure everyone enjoy the class. Must take her class!!!!!!!

Unbelievably amazing. Best prof at SFU. Lectures were very clear, and she set up meetings with students weekly to talk about anything related to course content or psychology. I wish she taught other classes, cause I would take them!

Lara was the best prof that I have ever had at SFU and I am seriously looking into working with her in the future. She was so passionate about the content and very upbeat. Her slides were easy to follow and her exams were also straight forward and if you studied then you did well in the class. Take any class with her if you can!!! :)

1st year teaching at SFU but easily seen already as one of the best prof yet. The course structure & engaging lectures are so well crafted it just blows your mind. She MAKES sure you understand with clear & colorful examples, videos, and demonstrations. Fair with marking if you put your time in it. I wish I went to UBC so I can be just like her.

One of the best professors I've ever had, and it was her first year teaching at SFU! Passionate and enthusiastic. Makes class enjoyable by using TV clips, getting students to act out experiments, bringing cookies to review sessions. Professional yet makes you feel like you're her friend. Would take another class with her, hands down. Delightful.

Nice, very clear and the assignments are well explained. The content is super interesting - happiness love stereotypes etc. But midterm was annoyin bc she asked more questions on who conducted which research instead of the main concepts , which is more important imo. Otherwise, shes great :)

I took this class in Fall 2019 and he was horrible. I went to office hours to get extra help since our TA had a family emergency. He laughed at me as I asked questions and told me to figure it out. Not sure what I could use to "figure it out" when there's no slides/textbook, only his three hour long lectures where he says ambiguous a million times.

He DOES NOT have lecture slides. He gets up there and talks for two hours straight and you better be taking notes. But otherwise, cool prof, cool course, and it teacher you a lot about how to read and interpret research articles.

Prof was understanding with late penalties and deadlines when COVID-19 hit. Good lecturer, interesting material. Assignments were straightforward, short, & easy. Would definitely recommended taking him for social psychology.

took this class spring 2020 during covid-19. prof. wright was super understanding about the situation and very helpful. lectures had slides that were posted but most only had pics, you spend the whole lecturing writing notes and there isn't a textbook. Not my favorite since I'm bad at taking good notes quickly, but the prof himself was nice
Was generous with grades and understanding about the mid semester switch to online format.

Good lectures and I enjoyed not having to buy an expensive textbook. Not having one does save money but also means attending every class is important. The cancelling of the final exam made it difficult to make up for my midterm grade but Dr. Wright did add a free letter grade to make up for the bumpy online transition.

Dr. Wright was really kind and understanding when I contacted him about my illness. I found the course entertaining informative, though the course was negatively impacted by the sudden move to the online format. I went to see Dr. Wright a few times in office hours and he was incredibly helpful and encouraging of my future career.

Prof Wright isn't the worst prof you could get by any means. His lectures were quite interesting, tho they were very heavy and he talks fast, so you have to be a good note-taker. He does carry a bit of a haughty air and was unnecessarily rude to me after I inquired about what I *still* think was an unfair grade. Was not easy for an 'intro' class.

I dont enjoy his style. He seems like a very intelligent guy but Im not sure that he enjoys teaching. Seems to have a know it all attitude about some things. If you take this course make sure you have something to type on because there barely any slides, most of what u learn will be based on what he says.

The lecture slides and the lecture itself was very difficult to follow along to, so be prepared to go back and listen to the 3 hour long lecture to take notes that actually make sense. Treat this course as if it's an upper division course, the TAs mark harshly and due to the fact that you need to know what's important/unimportant. Avoid if you can

A lot of ppl hated his tough grading bc he taught an intro course like an upper-div class. I personally enjoyed the class because it challenged me/made me into a better reader/writer. Went to office hours and he gave me gr8 advice so I felt more prepared to take psyc 300w. Hes rly nice in office hours! Exam (MC/SA) is easy if u study & do readings

Worst prof I have had at SFU in 4 years. Absolutely no structure to the course. No textbook and garbage powerpoint slides so it is very unclear what you should be focused on learning. Overly hard grader and will try to screw you over if he marks your paper. Under no circumstance would I recommend you taking this course with him. Terrible

AVOID THIS PROF AT ALL COSTS. He provides no materials for the entire course. Marking for assignments was unclear & unfair, average was 58%. In order to pass this course, each week I listened to his 3 hour audio lecture (which took more like 5 hours) to get accurate notes. This course made me question if I wanted to peruse social psychology.

A decent prof at the beginning of the semester but slowly he becomes your worst nightmare. Made it impossible to follow lectures in class, a waste of time to attend when you can listen to audio recordings later. Poor attitude and useless to access him during office hours, he' unwilling to provide help but rather make snarky comments. NO NOT TAKE!!!

He talks extremely fast so I had to re-listen to every lecture to take complete notes. There is no textbook and very few readings. If you study the lecture notes you'll do well on tests. Two assignments that were fairly marked.

Joshua Wright is a great professor. He is passionate about what he teaches. He isn't the traditional type, but if you show up, listen, and take notes you'll do well. He isn't going to spoon feed the information, but if you engage with the material on a critical level you'll do well. Not too much work required, and text book isn't mandatory.

Great public speaker but very off topic (taught mainly stats and critical analysis in a social psych class) I do not feel like I learned what I should have for 260. No required textbook. Projects had vague criteria making it hard to do well on them. Take detailed notes his slides are mostly blank. Not GPA booster. Added bonus he's nice to look at.

Dr. Wright is unlike other boring professors. The way he teaches makes you think critically about social psychology. You are actually learning a lot when you listen to his engaging lectures. Its not an easy class but nothing is easy in life. If you attend his lectures and take notes, you should excel in his class. The info you learn is long term.

He is a good lecturer. However, his teachings are more suited for an upper division class which can be unfair to some students. You HAVE to take good notes in class because his lec slides contain barely any info. Be sure to re-listen to the lec recordings if you miss anything. It really helps!

I liked the critical thinking approach he takes to concepts, you wont just memorize definitions. forces you to think. not an easy class but if you are actually interested in psychology it's worth it. gave great lectures that were posted online, and no participation marks so attendance not mandatory. PSA don't buy the textbook!

Dr. Wright gives amazing lectures. He lectures pretty fast and sometimes its hard to follow through. If you skip class, slides with ont be helpful. Lectures are recorded. He gave us 3 assignments to complete during the semester, midterm exam was difficult. Overall, this class seems like an upper division class or statistical research.
Dr. Wright is very knowledgeable and he is a good lecturer.

Overall, a good lecturer but is probably better suited for upper division course as he doesn't teach this course at an introductory level which isn't fair as a lot of students will go in expecting to learn more than they will.
Amazing professor.

How I wish more profs were. So many of my psych profs reads strait from slides and make class completely pointless. Dr. Wright gives good lectures but note taking is necessary. Slides have main points but you can't skip class and read slides as a replacement. Lectures recorded helps. Course content fairly easy but exam have short answer, hard.

Theres no question that Dr. Wright is very knowledgeable. The question is whether he can teach this class as an introductory class as it actually is an intro class. He doesnt. Book was mandatory and then it wasnt. His slides have no info. Hes heavy on videos/graphs/articles that should only complement your studies, and not be your main source.

I bought the textbook for this course (which it said was mandatory on the course outline) and we did not need it at all. There goes $70 down the drain. Also, he told us at the beginning of the semester that he tests us about things in his lecture slides, but half of them had no content. Never explained things clearly... terrible professor.

Teaches a very critical approach to psychology compared to the dull reading out of the textbook. Refreshing to hear someone explain how to really understand how to navigate the workings of psychology. People give him a rough time for not uploading lecture slides, but if you actually listen to what he says during lecture it's not to hard to follow.

Clear and usually entertaining lectures. Dr. Wright is very approachable, always talking with students after class. The course can be challenging, he talks fast and presents a lot of data. Often slides don't have a lot on them. No textbook so class is necessary to attend even though no participation marks. Taking his other course next term.

Highly recommend taking 260 with Dr. Wright. Different style than most psyc courses I have taken. Lecture focuses on evidence for theories and prof does a good job weighting pros and cons of different areas. Really enjoyed discussion of video games and violence section. Coming to class def. needed, though does record lectures.

First course that made me think deeply about psych. Dr. Wright is very critical of many studies, doesn't present findings as gold standards, and assignments force you to consider alternative views. Lots of articles to read but no txtbook. Exam require that you can make predictions from theory. Very hard but rewarding course if you can keep up.

Dr. Wright doesn't explain the subject at the 200 level. His lecture approach is more philosophical and based on critical thinking. They are unclear b/c he tends to discuss stuff off subject. You have to thoroughly understand terms and theories because you will be asked to apply them on complicated scenarios on the exam. Midterm average was 64% .

Definitely a difficult course but lectures are great and entertaining. Midterm was tough and expectations are high for the essays. All in all, I learned a lot. He emphasizes critical thinking and often talks about problems within social psychology and times when research conflicts.
Ive genuinely never been graded with this much scrutiny yet with little to no feedback in my entire life

The class with him is a good challenge for upper level students. He has high expectations and really emphasizes research methods and critical thinking. He welcomes criticism and encourages theoretical debate. He's a very engaging speaker, though he can talk fast sometimes. Overall one of the best classes I've taken.

First time seen him in his office hour, he rambles on and on, but later I found he is so enthusiastic about his class and is the most enlightening professor I have at SFU. Absolutely adorable and easy to approach.

TAKE THIS CLASS! TAKE THIS CLASS! If you need your 200 level requirement for psyc degree, GO ENROLL RIGHT NOW!!! He's an AMAZING prof, you learn SO much, keeps you engaged, he makes everything crystal clear and exams are exactly what he teaches! GO ENROLL! you will NOT be disappointed. Records his lecture too. You will get at least a b+

My favourite prof, I want to take more classes with him! He's hilarious, knowledgable, helpful, clear,  great at explaining and keeping things interesting.  Most of all, the marking is very fair (with exception to one TA, Norann) and if you disagree with your mark you can appeal it. Highly recommend this prof and class!
Funny, very enthusiastic professor. I loved going to his classes. His passion for social psychology really shows. Spend time on papers + read textbook!

He's not bad, but not as awesome as people say. He goes around in circle too much and goes off topics a lot of times, at the end, we didn't have time to cover TWO chapters! And the word limit on his papers are just ridicolous, and TA is very biased in their marking. But he explain really well and the class has some very interesting topics.

Steve Wright is an intellectual who truly loves what he does. His lectures are very clear and hard NOT to understand. He is genuinely interested in people and is always willing to talk to you and help you in any way possible. Extremely nice guy, can honestly say he is the reason I am focusing in Social Psychology. Favourite professor at SFU.

Amazing prof. makes the lectures fun and interesting so its easy to pay attention. Exams are fairly easy as long as you review lecture slides and keep up with readings. He's hilarious so its not painful to sit through a 2 hour lecture and gives lots of notice before assignments and papers are due.
3 words: BEST. PROF. EVER!
great prof. really prepares his students for any assignments, papers, and even exams. havent had a prof help out his class so much.

he's the best prof I've experienced so far!!! he doesn't "just" talk about what's in the text and on the slides; it's mostly his experiences, ideas, and study. He's not only hilarious but extremely cares about students and tries to help as much as possible.

Amazing professor! Keeps you engaged in the material and uses many examples of real-world studies. Only complaint is that he spends too much time on one slide. Otherwise, the class is easy, the textbook is interesting to read, and his exams are also easy - I got A's on both the midterm and final, and I never get A's on psych exams!

I have never seen a teacher who so honestly wants his students to do well. Prof. Wright has an obvious, honest, and unrelenting passion for social Psychology that is infectious. His method of teaching is the clearest I've ever come across. The one thing I'd like to see changed: the textbook. The lectures seem to be more important, GO TO CLASS.

Honestly, very tough to get anything above an A-. I have a high gpa and so do many of the people I know, but we are all frustrated with the marking system. So it is not the course content that is hard, in fact it is really easy but the marking system is unfair and SOME of the TA's can be tough markers (for the papers).
Interesting lectures, most of the exam is from lecture material. Horrible marking system, do not like it even though I did well in the class.
Probably the Best Prof I've ever had... he has a passion for what he's talking about.. it's great.

A very entertaining prof. Unlike others, I had no problem with the grading system, because the tests are SO straightforward. Study both the text and the lecture notes. Lectures for a long time on the subject of prejudice, at the expense of other subjects, but that's understandable as that's his area of research.

Make sure you have your coffee and go to the can before class, as his lectures can be repetative, and you only have a 5min break. Good stories, funny guy, marking system is fair. If the highest exam mark is 55/60, than that person gets a 100%, than letter grades are distributed from that mark.

I'M SORRY BUT HE HAS THE WORSE GRADING SYSTEM EVER. REALLY IF YOU WANT TO DO BAD THEN TAKE THIS CLASS BECAUSE IF YOU'RE EXPECTING TO GET EVEN A B-, YOU'D NEED 80%. DON'T GO IN ASSUMING YOU CAN GET A B- WITH 70% BECAUSE YOU'D END UP GETTING A C-. SO UNREASONABLE!

Really interesting/funny prof. But he keeps repeating simple concepts and giving 500 examples for everything - so it takes him forever to get through one slide. Tests were easy, i got 93% and that's an A- apparently? :S The way he scales the grades is the one really bad thing about this prof.

You are gauranteed to laugh out loud every class-he's hillarious. However, he tries to cram way too much info into each class and is quite disorganized, but he does make a really uninteresting subject more fun and you won't fall asleep cuz he runs back and forth flailing his arms and speaks really loudly.

I'm shocked at the amount of people who don't seem to mind his grading system. Those of you must not realize that having an 80% class average and an easier exam is not better if the letter grades distributed for those scores are lower. It's the letter grade that goes towards your GPA and what matters in the end, not the percent! Think about it...

He is HORRIBLE! He rambles on way too much about nothing, and doesn't take breaks on time. He knows the material is easy, so he came up with a ridiculously unfair marking scheme. His grading scale hurts you more than it helps. 60% is a pass, and only 95% is an A! I will never take him again and don't recommend that anyone else does either.

I thought Steven was an awesome prof. Although it might seem ridiculous that an A is 95%, his exams were designed to be easy. Therefore, the class average is in the mid 80 percent tile. I would definately recomment taking another class with him!

he's an alright person.....not rude or anything...but his marking scheme was totally stupid...and A is like 95% or higher.... and he didn't tell us until after the midterm was marked.... he rambled on and on about his kid... can be boring at times....dont know if i'll take another course with him..

god, this guy was not so good. his marking scheme was rediculus, scaled WAY up so an A is only 95% and above or something like that. Also, his stories went all of the place and were way too frequent and redundant.  I wouldnt take anothe class with him.

good prof who knows the material well. his grading scheme is higher cuz he aims for 85% avg whereas other profs go for 70-75% avg, but he only explained this AFTER the midterm. tutorials were a waste of time & i only went for the attendance & participation marks.

Great guy, kind,helpful.Passionate about his subject, makes it interesting w/fun stories. Tutorials were ok. Very willing to help you & responded to emails promptly. Recommend him highly.Marking a bit strange but he explains it.

great professor, really funny and interesting. teaches from the text and uses power point. Tutorials are a waste of time but the class itself is interesting. I would definitely take one of his classes again.
good guy. talks a lot about very little, but at least makes it interesting with bizzare examples. Tests are really easy.

He's an awsome teacher!! Will try and help you as much as he can as long as you make your self known to him. He is very pasionate about his field and does an excellent job. You'll love the guy! Highly Recomended

AWESOME, AWESOME prof! I want to take all of his courses! Lecture style is very interesting, course material itself is very intersting. Grading scheme is wacko though, but you will do well on his exams. AWESOME!!
I love Angel! Her lectures, exams and grading criteria are very clear and straightforward. I took 260 with her and now I'm taking a selected topics with her. I would definitely recommend.

Very caring prof and has clear expectations. English is not her first language but you can still understand her lectures. The assignments and exams were marked very hard by the TAs. The minimum requirements will not get you a decent grade. She marks attendance through i-clicker participation (4%). A 78% will get you a B- in this class.

The class is SUPER easy, but he's a tool. Take the class because it's a GPA booster - he gives you 'exam prep' and they are the same questions that will be on the exams. Even the assignment is based soley on personal work - no referencing needed. He is an ok prof, just seems a little immature.
So boring.  He's a great guy and he definitely wants his students to do well, but man oh man, his lecturing style is dry.  Might improve in a few years.
he is an awesome prof. he gives study guides before the midterm and the final which is pretty much a copy of the actual test.lol. if u just do the study guide u'll do okay.
Very boring lectures but you have to listen to them as he tests mostly on lecture material. Exams are really easy and the papers were graded easily as well. I think the average on both was around 80.

He may be good in a few years when he realizes that good professors lecture from their own material and not  straight out of the text. He also posts his lectures online and just reads them aloud in class, therefore the attendance in his lectures is getting smaller and smaller. Very boring class, but he may get better.
Terrible, extremely ssllooowww lectures, vague slides, unclear description of the ASSIGNMENTS. take it with someone else

There were a lot of writing for this course, but they were not difficult. The lectures do tend to be long and boring, but the studies that she talks about are very interesting. Exams were fair. Would definitely take another class with her.

She seems really nice but extremely boring. She'd draw out lectures for the full 3hrs although content shouldn't have taken that long. She's changed her syllabus so it's harder to do well. Too many assignments, unfair marking (mark down for grammar/syntax) - Treated the course like a W course. Focused on studies far too much. Wouldn't recommend.

Janelle is a really nice person but super boring. Her lectures were a waste of my 3 hours every week. She focuses too much on studies rather than application. Assignments are really easy and a great way to boost your mark. Midterm and final were fair. You just need to know your stuff. Wouldn't take another course with her though.

Assignments were very easy, basically guaranteed marks and took very little time to do. Uses lots of research examples, which can be daunting, but are still interesting. Not the easiest class, but it was worth taking.

I don't know if this was her first semester, but I just didn't like her class. She turned a course on a fascinating subject (social psyc) into the most boring class I've taken at SFU. She treated questioners in class very rudely and made unfair exams that required rote memorization of studies, studies, and more studies. Never taking her class again

Her lectures go by very slowly, and her assignments are tedious. Exams are heavily dependent on one's ability to memorize specific studies, rather than understand and apply concepts -- even "application" questions constrain one to referencing lecture and text material from memory, without any sort of direction as to which topic might be covered.

All content discussed in class were from the textbook, so rely on that when studying for her exams. Attend the lectures because she writes down definitions on the board and is not in the slides. The group discussions were graded very harshly and guidelines were unclear. Hard to reach outside of class and responded to my email 3 weeks later.

I found this class with Dr. Davis really interesting and engaging. She explains concepts clearly, and the textbook helps deepen your understanding. It made the exams, which ask you to apply the concepts situationally, much easier. The podcasts were interesting, and I enjoyed the group discussions. You can do well if you engage with the material!

Did not like her. Along with a 2 hour lecture, we were meant to listen to an hour long podcast each week and come to the 50 min discussion classes. Paper was easy but the questions on her exams make no sense. I could recite the textbook and didn't do well on the first 2 exams. A lot of the content was covered in 102. Last one was super easy though.

Friendly but bad prof. Exams are random and often do not reflect what we learn in class. Podcast discussions do not provide much to the course and are graded with very vague guidelines, seems impossible to do well. Slides have like 3 words on them-if you miss a class you are screwed, no recordings posted. Everything felt like a trick to lose marks.

The prof wasn't great, her teaching style is boring and she assigned 1 hour podcasts to discuss and write about each week without giving a clear grading criteria. 
Hard marker and the short answer questions on exams had to do with activities she did in class so if you didn't attend you won't be able to answer the SAQ

Course material is exciting but her way of teaching isn't. You'll be assigned to discuss buncha boring podcasts with your group and they grade them randomly. Her questions and wording is also vague. Take notes of out of slides material she mentions, it'll be on exams. If you're lucky, you'll be in a good group for discussion and your TA is Jesse.

Prof Davis is kind and approachable, but the course lacks structure. Podcasts don't clearly relate to the topics we're supposed to discuss, lectures aren't recorded and feel disconnected. Content focuses on definitions, while exams are more scenario-based with little prep. The material is interesting, but hard to enjoy because of how it's taught.

DrDavis is very inspirational professor. She really cares about her students, never tires of answering questions, and is always open to clarify whatever students find unclear. Podcasts weren't my favorite, but she used then to encourage engagement with the content and attendance, which is fine. She is kind and approachable, and would recommend her.

She's nice and seems to care about students but class was set up strange, 1 hr class to talk about a podcast each week (annoying) which she randomly marks certain ones so you have to go each week. Then 2hr lecture she has a lot of examples but no break so I get bored. Overall okay class, I loved the material but lectures were slightly boring
Boring and useless.  Stop talking about webCT and start talking about what you're supposed to be teaching.  No depth, no interesting stories or comments.  Really disappointing.
Wonderful professor.
i thought he was very approachable and mad the class interesting.  I also thought his exams were tough but fair
dont like him.. once gave us a midterm in psyc 100 or 102 the day after Halloween. dont like how he swears in lecture either. it's inappropriate
amazing prof!! makes lecture very interesting, and is very clear on expectations.

She means well and puts a ton of effort into preparing lectures and "fun" class activities but lectures still end up being very dull. Participation is heavy, definitely go to class. The worst part were the assignments, marking seemed very subjective and there was little room for creativity. I strongly recommend going to the TA's office hours.

Lisa's lectures drag on as she constantly repeats herself in a slow, irritating voice. She doesn't organize herself efficiently which results in having to finish lectures next class. If she does finish, instead of ending class early, she starts the next lecture. I only attended for the participation marks and would not recommend taking her class.

Lisa is well prepared and her expectations are clear. She repeats and outlines important information needed to get the grades. Her exams come directly from lecture and from the readings. Her papers are marked exactly how she outlines. She does useful and fun demonstrations and is very engaging. I really enjoyed her classes and her teaching style.

Lisa is really nice and social psych is super easy. However,  I found her awfully boring. I can't pay attention in class because she really doesn't make it interesting. I do enjoy social psych but she made me feel like it's dry when it isn't. I also never bought the textbook and still did great.

Lisa is by far the most amazing professor I have had at SFU! She is very thorough and super organized in regards to lecture material and homework assignments. She is super friendly and has such a great sense of humour! Her classes are not hard if you do the readings and study her lecture notes.

I loved Lisa. She is super helpful and clear. Her classes are slightly boring, due to the material, but she tries to make it entertaining. Exams were straightforward and 3 papers are quite easy. She's an awesome teacher!

His class is very manageable. He teaches well and makes sure everything is clear, does some activities to help remember the concepts better...first day, he gave away chocolate! Oh & the videos he showed us in class are funny but still educational!

This guy is awesome! Makes lectures (more) interesting with lots of video clips, sometimes funny but always relevant. Which helps to remember stuff. His exams are fair. Read the text!Definitely recommend his class.

Lectures were engaging at times, boring at others. Then he had us do lecture comprehension checks after each class that he was supposed to answer the next class but he literally never answered any of my questions. Students were not encouraged to engage deeply with the material. Would get almost 100% on multiple choice and 50% on SA. seems weird.

Dylan was ok. The content in the course was easy and he was kind of funny. At one point he said humans were the only animals that utilize non-verbal communication.... Uuuhhhh?? Tried to interact with him after lectures a couple times and he was not friendly or personable. I found either him or the TAs to be really tough graders on papers.

This was Dylan's first term teaching so he seemed a bit nervous and a little disorganized but if you stayed on top of the assignments & lectures you'll do great! His lecture slides can be a bit confusing if you don't go to class you'll be a little lost but they are recorded!! He's a super fair and relaxed prof, definitely recommend!!

Spring 2019 was Dylan's first term teaching a class so of course he was not perfect with his lectures. However, he was interested in what the students were thinking and open to changes. His lecture comprehension checks are helpful and he is always looking for ways to improve his class and students' learning. FREE ONLINE BOOK was good and precise

He can't explain the concepts clearly, as he always jump from one thing to another, and leaves us with so many questions and confusions, wasn't clear what he expected on assignment as well as the midterm. Very boring lecture..

Had Dylan for intro to social. Was greatly disappointed. He was a bit arrogant and constantly spoke down to you if you did not immediately understand him or a concept. Marked me down on my paper for incorrect APA but when I showed him the APA guideline he began arguing more. Dont take him
Very good lectures. The essay grading was very nitpicky, but despite that I did alright. Exams were fair and based exactly on what he said they would be on.

He is the best professor for Psyc 260 course, such good and easy presentation of the material. His study guides make exams so easy and I actually learned a lot in his class as it would focus only on important material. Amazing professor.

One of the best profs I've had at SFU by far, you can tell he wants everyone to succeed and makes the course content super easy to digest and so interesting! Definitely one of those profs you look up by name and enroll in their course just because they're the one teaching it. Highly recommend.

He is honestly such a bright soul, you can tell how passionate he is about social psychology, which makes you so much more engaged. He is clear on what he expects and cares about his student. Also has a very cute dog named Asher iykyk. if you have the chance to take a class with him do it.

The best professor I have ever had!! Lectures are super interesting and engaging. He clearly cares about the students doing well. Lecture videos are posted after class and he holds extra office hours. Grading and exams are fair and it's clear what will be on them. I would definitely recommend taking a class with Jason.

Jason is one of the best professors I've ever experienced at SFU. He is kind and truly cares about each individual student succeeding in his classes. Highly recommend taking a class with him, it's an easy A.

taking this class with jason was the best decision i made. this class is content-heavy (as is every other psyc class), but he makes it so easy to comprehend and provides useful study guides for the midterm and final. he is open to student feedback and ACTUALLY listens, and he is overall a kind and caring prof who wants you to succeed.

One of the best profs I have ever had, he truly cares about his students success and is willing to help out wherever needed. I will be the first in line if he ever teaches another course at SFU :) 100% you will not regret taking a course taught by Jason :)

If you're contemplating between another psyc class and this one, definitely go with psyc 260! Jason's lectures are well-structured and easy to follow. He makes all materials and resources accessible on canvas and often brought snacks to lecture for his students. Overall he is an amazing professor and genuinely cares about his students!

this prof was amazing! course content is straightforward, exam prep can be done using mostly lecture slides, assignments are marked fairly, and assignments/exams are done in a way that promotes learning growth. i would 100% recommend to take a class with this professor he made taking PSYC260 enjoyable.

when I say this man is for the students I mean it. He was so sweet & super transparent about what midterm & final would look like (for the midterm he provided the units the SA questions would be from which was super helpful), midterm & final he gave the choice to stay & redo the MC with a group for a chance to boost ur own grade:)

jason is by far the best prof i have met. the amount of care he has for his students is amazing, and rare. truly wants all his students to succeed, and is so easy to approach. really just a kind human being. would 100% take any class he teaches.

Jason is an amazing prof, he genuinely cares deeply for his students. lectures are interesting and exam material is straight forward. I will definitely take another class with him if I could. also love how he includes his puppy in lectures. 10/10
He is THE MOST CARING prof I've come across, HE EXTREMELY CARES about every student. I cannot wait to see him teaching more classes. He is just such an amazing soul!

Jason is the best prof I have had at SFU. He is always available to help. His lectures are very interesting and engaging. He also provides clear rubrics and feedback. You can just tell Jason is a good person. If you have the chance, definitely take his class!!!!
By far the best Prof in the entire Psych department!

In my 3 years of university, Jason has been the most impactful prof I've ever had. He truly cares about his students and you can tell he is passionate about what he teaches. He really changed the game for my expectations as a prof, he went above and beyond from the good of his heart and he deserves the world. Bonus points he has the cutest dog !!

He is not only overall nice and understanding but you can tell he puts in effort to make the class interesting. The class is easy to follow in my opinion and he is very organized. I also found it easy to contact him outside of class time to ask questions. The papers are easy if you study well which is quite fair. Overall good class

Jason was one of the best professors I've had and as a first time instructor he did a great job. His lectures and lecture materials were straightforward and easy to understand. His exams were fairly easy as well and he cares about his students overall well being a lot. My favourite part of his class was pictures of his cute puppy Asher!
great prof didn't score well due to my own mistake but he taught so well, and the lectures were engaging. even when recorded

Despite only being a lecturer for the first time, Jason did such an amazing job with this class. It was definitely the most engaging and most interesting class I've had so far in my undergrad degree. The lecture content is straightforward and the exams were fair. I would love to see him teach other PSYC courses as well!

Amazing prof! He really seemed to care about improvement and truly understanding the material. Just make sure to pay attention to his lectures. Overall would definitely take again if I can! (Also his dog photos of Ascher were cute).

Jason is simply just awesome. I only wish he taught more classes, He did great for his first time teaching. All lectures were enjoyable and engaging. More importantly, he clearly cares about his students. Every week he would go over improvements suggested by his student. There was an instance where he gave us a mental health break week. Truly great

His class was amazing. If I ever get the chance to have him as my professor again, I'd be so thankful and happy. He cares and is genuine. His class is based on growth, meaning second chances for a quiz and assignment. His exams were fair and actually tested us on the knowledge that mattered. best psyc grade I've gotten. study his lectures. txt no $
Definitely take this class. The class is of average difficulty but the content and Jason are awesome! His dog Asher is adorable.

Jason is such a good prof!!! It was his first semester teaching, and was my favorite prof I've had so far. He is clearly passionate about the subject matter and cares for his students and genuinely wants them to do well. Lectures are very clear, with interactive parts mixed in. Bonus: he has an adorable dog that he provides many pictures of.

Jason was a pleasure to have as a professor. He is a gem. For being his first time teaching, he truly knows how to engage with students. Whenever he is given feedback, he ensures to incorporate it into the course. If all professors were like Jason, so much more students would enjoy university and actually learn course material.

Good stuff. His classes are fun and he includes a lot of videos and makes it very interactive! He always wants what's best for students and really welcomes feedback.

The only problem is his work often takes more time than allotted. He keeps uploading videos and sending multiple announcements and it's tiring trying to keep up with extra time.
One of the best professors Ive ever had. Genuinely cares for students and wants the students to succeed. Fairly easy course load and overall great guy. Highly recommend

TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM IF YOU CAN! Jason was by far one of the best professors I've had! You can tell he genuinely cares for his students and is passionate about what he is teaching. The exams were fair, and there were only two major assignments. Overall, this class was really enjoyable, and I will definitely miss this class.

Jason was the best professor I have had so far in university. Engaging and interesting lectures, and exams that were quite fair. He truly cares to see his students succeed and made sure to check in once a week with everyone to make sure we were following along well in the course. Will miss this class for sure!

Loved taking his class, super supportive with student's learning encouraging. An absolute joy taking his class. Overall structure of classes were organized, easy to understand, workload wasn't heavy. Exams were fair so long as you studied and paid attention to lectures. Did two articles review analysis, second one was optional to improve mark.
